items.headline: Here’s how high tariff rates would have to rise to bring manufacturing back to its glory days. Even Trump would be shocked.
items.summary_en: Economists at UBS pointed to analysis done by the center-right American Enterprise Institute, which calculated that tariffs would have to be set at 42.5% to level out manufacturing imports and exports.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Who is reshaping the way we live, work, spend and invest? Meet the MarketWatch 25.

items.headline: Chanos declares victory in his bet vs. Strategy’s Saylor

items.headline: The lone bear on Meta’s stock foresaw its struggles — and sees more trouble ahead

items.headline: Pfizer won its fight to buy an obesity-drug maker. It took an extra $1.7 billion and a phone call.
items.summary_en: Pfizer is buying its way back into the obesity-drug game after fighting off a rival bid from Novo Nordisk to buy Metsera, with more money and help from the Trump administration.
